methods.name: paymaster_isAvailable
methods.summary: Returns the status of the paymaster service

result.name: result
result.description: If the paymaster service is correctly functioning, return true. Else, return false

methods.name: paymaster_getSupportedTokensAndPrices
methods.summary: Get a list of the tokens that the paymaster supports, together with their prices in STRK

params.name: tracking_id
params.description: A unique identifier used to track an execution request of a user. This identitifier is returned by the paymaster after a successful call to `execute`. Its purpose is to track the possibly different transaction hashes in the mempool which are associated with a same user request

result.name: result
result.description: The hash of the latest transaction broadcasted by the paymaster corresponding to the requested ID and the status of the ID

status.title: Status
status.description: A status of 'active' indicates that the latest transaction associated with the ID is not yet included in a block but is still being handled and monitored by the paymaster. A status of 'accepted' means that a transaction associated with the ID has been accepted on L2. A status of 'dropped' means that no transaction associated with the ID managed to enter a block and the request has been dropped by the paymaster. In all cases, the returned transaction hash must be the hash of the most recent tx sent by the paymaster and corresponding to the ID

methods.name: paymaster_buildTypedData
methods.summary: Receives the transaction the user wants to execute. Returns the typed data along with the estimated gas cost and the maximum gas cost suggested to ensure execution

params.name: transaction
params.description: Transaction to be executed by the paymaster

params.name: parameters
params.description: Execution parameters to be used when executing the transaction

result.name: result
result.description: The typed data that the user needs to sign, together with information about the fee

schema.title: Execute from outside typed data and the fee information related to the transaction built

methods.name: paymaster_execute
methods.summary: Sends the signed typed data to the paymaster service for execution

schema.title: Transaction
schema.description: Typed data build by calling paymaster_buildTypedData signed by the user to be executed by the paymaster service

result.name: result
result.description: The hash of the transaction broadcasted by the paymaster and the tracking ID corresponding to the user `execute` request

tracking_id.title: Tracking ID
tracking_id.description: A unique identifier used to track an execution request of a user. Its purpose is to track possibly different transactions sent by the paymaster and which are associated with a same user request. Such cases can happen during congestion, where a fee or tip bump may be needed in order for a transaction to enter a block

deployment.title: Deployment data
deployment.description: Deployment data necessary to deploy the account

invoke.title: Invoke data
invoke.description: Invoke data signed by the user to be executed by the paymaster service

deployment.title: Deployment data
deployment.description: Deployment data necessary to deploy the account

invoke.title: Invoke data
invoke.description: Invoke data signed by the user to be executed by the paymaster service

user_address.title: User Account
user_address.description: The address of the user account

typed_data.title: Typed data
typed_data.description: Typed data returned by the endpoint paymaster_buildTypedData

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: Signature of the associated Typed Data

deployment.title: Deployment data
deployment.description: Deployment data necessary to deploy the account

invoke.title: Invoke data
invoke.description: Invoke data to a transaction on behalf of the user

deployment.title: Deployment data

invoke.title: Invoke data
invoke.description: Invoke data to a transaction on behalf of the user

PAYMASTER_INVOKE.title: Invoke Parameters
PAYMASTER_INVOKE.description: Calls to be executed by the paymaster and the user account address that will be called

user_address.title: User Account
user_address.description: The address of the user account

calls.title: Calls to execute
calls.description: The sequence of calls that the user wishes to perform

PAYMASTER_EXECUTION.title: Execution parameters
PAYMASTER_EXECUTION.description: Execution parameters to used when executing the transaction through the paymaster

fee_mode.title: Fee Mode
fee_mode.description: Fee mode to use for the execution

PAYMASTER_FEE_MODE.title: Paymaster fee mode
PAYMASTER_FEE_MODE.description: Specify how the transaction should be paid. Either by the user specifying a gas token or through sponsorship

oneOf.title: Sponsor transaction
oneOf.description: Specify that the transaction should be sponsored. This argument does not guaranteed sponsorship and will depend on the paymaster provider

oneOf.title: Pay transaction in gas token
oneOf.description: Default fee mode where the transaction is paid by the user in the given gas token

oneOf.title: Pay transaction in gas token with an added tip
oneOf.description: Fee mode where the transaction is paid by the user in the given gas token and the user can specify a tip

gas_token_price_in_strk.title: Price in STRK
gas_token_price_in_strk.description: The exchange rate between the chosen token and STRK that is used in the estimation

suggested_max_fee_in_strk.title: Suggested max fee in STRK
suggested_max_fee_in_strk.description: The estimated max token amount that the user is required to allow for the paymaster transaction. This is only an informative field: its semantics is not enforced in the subsequent flow. This information is extractable from the typed data object

suggested_max_fee_in_gas_token.title: Suggested max fee in gas token
suggested_max_fee_in_gas_token.description: The estimated max token amount that the user is required to allow for the paymaster transaction. This is only an informative field: its semantics is not enforced in the subsequent flow. This information is extractable from the typed data object

CLASS_HASH.title: Class hash
CLASS_HASH.description: Class hash of a class on Starknet

FELT.title: Field element
FELT.description: A field element. represented by a hex string of length at most 63

u256.title: u256
u256.description: 256 bit unsigned integers, represented by a hex string of length at most 64

NUMERIC.title: Numeric string
NUMERIC.description: A string representing an unsigned integer

CALL.title: Call
CALL.description: The object that defines an invocation of a function in a contract

calldata.title: Calldata
calldata.description: Inputs for the entry point function

TRACKING_ID.description: A unique identifier corresponding to an `execute` request to the paymaster
TRACKING_ID.title: Tracking ID

OUTSIDE_EXECUTION_TYPED_DATA.title: Typed data for outside execution
OUTSIDE_EXECUTION_TYPED_DATA.description: A typed data object (in the sense of SNIP-12) which represents an outside execution payload, according to SNIP-9

TOKEN_DATA.title: Token data
TOKEN_DATA.description: Object containing data about the token: contract address, number of decimals and current price in STRK

decimals.title: Decimals
decimals.description: The number of decimals of the token

TIME_BOUNDS.title: Time bounds
TIME_BOUNDS.description: Object containing timestamps corresponding to `Execute After` and `Execute Before`

execute_after.title: Execute After
execute_after.description: A lower bound after which an outside call is valid

execute_before.title: Execute Before
execute_before.description: An upper bound before which an outside call is valid

STARKNET_TYPE.title: Starknet Type
STARKNET_TYPE.description: A single type, as part of a struct. The `type` field can be any of the EIP-712 supported types

caller.title: Caller address
caller.description: The account address of the user

nonce.title: Nonce
nonce.description: The nonce used in the outside execution protocol

execute_after.title: Minimum timestamp
execute_after.description: Timestamp after which the outside execution is valid and possible

execute_before.title: Maximum timestamp
execute_before.description: Timestamp before which the outside execution is valid and possible

calls_len.title: Calls length
calls_len.description: Length of the array of calls returned by the paymaster service

calls.description: The array of calls returned by the paymaster service
